p: Between 8% and 35% of new reported HIV cases in almost all regions globally in 2017 were estimated to occur among men who purchase sex and sexual partners of high-risk groups [ 1], In many Asian countries, men who purchase sex represent the largest single network of people which often face elevated HIV risk in relation to the general population [ 2]. With a total population of men in Asia at more than 2.3 billion [ 3], estimates have ranged from 0.5% to 15% of the adult male population as having purchased sex [ 2] from female sex workers, among whom HIV prevalence was estimated at 5.2% in Asia in 2012 [ 4].
